Sequence Information.Peptide Name: Mesentericin Y105 (MesY105, natural AMPs? class 2a bacteriocin, Gram-positive bacteria, prokaryotes)
Sequence Information.Crucial residues: Trp, N-terminal KYY, and S-S bond.

Literature Information.Literature: 91.89% similar to 	Leucocin A (AP00199). G: 22%; N: 11%.Activity: exhibiting a narrow bactericidal spectrum limited to genus Listeria such as L. monocytogenes.SAR: Removal of the N-terminal KYY led to the activity reduction to 0.04%. In addition, the absence of a single Trp residue of the mesentericin Y105 caused a 10,000-fold diminution of the anti-microbial activity. Seq corrected and updated 3/2023.
Literature Information.Author: Hechard Y et al Cenatiempo Y1992
Literature Information.Title: Characterization and purification of mesentericin Y105, an anti-Listeria bacteriocin from Leuconostoc mesenteroides
